content: curly shirley scarf to join the curly shirley family cardi and beanie i ve created a scarf with the increasingly iconic ringlet curls at the end i ve made the scarf relatively short 70cm/27 end to end excluding curls but have made a hole near one end to slip the other end through doing away with the need for length to wrap around and now the pattern  written using us crochet terms us half_double_crochet = uk half_double_crochet us double_crochet = uk treble_crochet  us - h 5 00mm hook  20 g each of stylecraft special dk yarn colour a candyfloss o colour b apricot o colour c lemon o colour d spring green o colour e sherbet o colour f wisteria o  gauge 14 sts x 8 row = 10cm 4 in double_crochet definitions and tutorials - thanks to moogly for the video tutorials  fdc foundation double_crochet  fhdc - foundation half_double_crochet  joiner stitch - a joiner between fdc and double_crochet yo insert hook into the v_stitch at bottom of the previous fdc insert hook into double_crochet from previous row where you d normally join a double_crochet after a bunch of chains yo pull through 2 loops yo pull through 2 loops yo pull through 2 loops please note i crochet left-handed so some of my photos might look backwards - i hope this doesn t throw anyone instructions row 1 with colour a fdc 100 chain 16 row 2 starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total continue with one double_crochet in each fdc 100dc then ch16 row 3 still with colour a starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total change colour in the end of the 45th double_crochet continuing the row now in colour b double_crochet in each double_crochet along the row 100dc ch16 row 4 starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total continue with one double_crochet in each fdc 100dc then ch16 row 5 still with colour b starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total change colour in the end of the 45th double_crochet continuing the row now in colour c double_crochet in each double_crochet along the row 100dc ch16 row 6 starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total continue with one double_crochet in each fdc 100dc then ch16 row 7 still with colour c starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc in each chain 45 double_crochet total change colour in the end of the 45th double_crochet continuing the row now in colour d double_crochet in the next 10sts then fdc 20 i worked the first fdc into the same stitch from row 6 as my last regular double_crochet in row 7 skip 20 joiner stitch see special stitches then double_crochet to the end of the row 10dc 20fdc 70dc = 100dc total ch16 row 8 starting in 2nd chain from hook 3dc
